citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Brumimicrobium (Bru′mi.mi.cro′bi.um. L. fem. n. bruma winter; N.L. neut. n. microbium microbe; N.L. neut. n. Brumimicrobium winter microbe).
Cells are slightly curved or straight rods with rounded ends.
Do not form microcysts or gas vesicles.
Do not form circular, coiled or helical cells.
Cell mass is pigmented intensely orange.
Cold-adapted, marine, facultatively anaerobic, fermentative chemoheterotrophs that require Na+ ions, yeast extract and vitamins for growth.
Fatty acids consist mostly of branched-chain components including i13 : 0, a15 : 1ω10c and i15 : 0.
A member of class Flavobacteria according to 16S rDNA sequence analysis.
The type species is Brumimicrobium glaciale.
